description: Master database of verified case law citations - updated with ChatGPT verification and research findings
verification_source: ChatGPT case law audit + automated research findings

section_1782_discovery.description: 28 U.S.C. § 1782 discovery cases - verified by ChatGPT

cases.case_name: Intel Corp. v. Advanced Micro Devices, Inc.
cases.full_citation: Intel Corp. v. Advanced Micro Devices, Inc., 542 U.S. 241 (2004)
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.relevance: Bedrock § 1782 case; sets the Intel factors
key_holdings: Establishes discretionary Intel factors for § 1782
Defines 'interested person' and 'foreign proceeding'
Governing framework for all § 1782 motions

cases.case_name: Brandi-Dohrn v. IKB Deutsche Industriebank AG
cases.full_citation: Brandi-Dohrn v. IKB Deutsche Industriebank AG, 673 F.3d 76 (2d Cir. 2012)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
cases.relevance: Admissibility in foreign forum is not required under § 1782
key_holdings: Rejects requirement that evidence be admissible in foreign forum
Clarifies scope of § 1782 discovery

cases.full_citation: In re del Valle Ruiz, 939 F.3d 520 (2d Cir. 2019)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit
cases.relevance: 'Resides or is found' test; limits on extraterritorial reach
key_holdings: Clarifies 'resides or is found' requirement
Establishes limits on extraterritorial subpoena reach

cases.full_citation: O'Keeffe v. Adelson (District Court, D.N.J. / Court of Appeals for the Eleventh Circuit, 2016)
cases.court: District Court, D.N.J. / Eleventh Circuit
cases.relevance: § 1782 granted in aid of Hong Kong libel litigation - strong analogy to your case
key_holdings: § 1782 discovery granted for Hong Kong defamation proceeding
Fact pattern similar to your case

cases.full_citation: Macquarie Bank Ltd. § 1782 decisions, District Court, D. Nevada (2015)
cases.court: District Court, D. Nevada
cases.relevance: Participant vs. non-participant and availability abroad under Intel factors
key_holdings: Addresses participant vs. non-participant distinction
Discusses 'availability abroad' factor

sealing_pseudonymity.description: Sealing and pseudonymity cases - verified by ChatGPT

cases.full_citation: Nixon v. Warner Communications, Inc., 435 U.S. 589 (1978)
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.relevance: Common-law access; balancing test for impound/sealing
key_holdings: Establishes discretionary nature of public access
Balancing test for sealing/impound motions

cases.full_citation: Doe v. Stegall, 653 F.2d 180 (5th Cir. 1981)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
cases.relevance: Anonymity factors for threats/retaliation - supports pseudonym motion
key_holdings: Factors for granting pseudonym treatment
Threats and retaliation as justification

cases.case_name: Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court (Press-Enterprise I)
cases.full_citation: Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court (Press-Enterprise I), 464 U.S. 501 (1984)
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.relevance: Recognizes qualified First Amendment right of access; sealing requires a compelling interest and narrow tailoring.
key_holdings: Recognizes qualified First Amendment right of access; sealing requires a compelling interest and narrow tailoring

cases.case_name: Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court (Press-Enterprise II)
cases.full_citation: Press-Enterprise Co. v. Superior Court (Press-Enterprise II), 478 U.S. 1 (1986)
cases.court: Supreme Court of the United States
cases.relevance: Extends same balancing to pre-trial proceedings; courts must make specific findings justifying sealing.
key_holdings: Extends same balancing to pre-trial proceedings; courts must make specific findings justifying sealing

cases.full_citation: In re Boston Herald, Inc., 321 F.3d 174 (2003)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the First Circuit
cases.relevance: Articulates the First Circuit's test for sealing and access limitations.
key_holdings: Articulates the First Circuit's test for sealing and access limitations

cases.full_citation: Globe Newspaper Co. v. Pokaski, 868 F.2d 497 (1989)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the First Circuit
cases.relevance: Acknowledges presumption of access but permits closure to protect compelling privacy interests.
key_holdings: Acknowledges presumption of access but permits closure to protect compelling privacy interests

cases.full_citation: AF Holdings, LLC v. Does 1–1058, 752 F.3d 990 (2014)
cases.court: Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit
cases.relevance: Warns of abuse in unmasking anonymous litigants; requires protective safeguards.
key_holdings: Warns of abuse in unmasking anonymous litigants; requires protective safeguards

cases.full_citation: London-Sire Records, Inc. v. Doe 1, 542 F. Supp. 2d 153 (2008)
cases.court: District Court, D. Massachusetts
cases.relevance: Five-factor test for revealing anonymous parties; emphasizes privacy in digital-context litigation.
key_holdings: Five-factor test for revealing anonymous parties; emphasizes privacy in digital-context litigation

cases.case_name: Sony Music Entertainment Inc. v. Does 1–40
cases.full_citation: Sony Music Entertainment Inc. v. Does 1–40, 326 F. Supp. 2d 556 (2004)
cases.court: District Court, S.D. New York
cases.relevance: Seminal authority on balancing discovery needs with Doe defendants' right to anonymity.
key_holdings: Seminal authority on balancing discovery needs with Doe defendants' right to anonymity
